description: Spawn child agent with isolated identity and memory
steps: 1. Parent deploys new VM (openclaw-deploy or manual)
2. On child VM: amcp identity create → new AID + keypairs
4. Parent records child's AID (for monitoring, not access)
5. Child creates first checkpoint: previousCID=null, parentAID=parent.aid
6. Child registers on Solvr with their own account
- Parent CANNOT read child's checkpoints (different AID + private key)
- No shared keys, no shared encryption, no shared memories
- parentAID is metadata for lineage tracking only
✅ Verify child's checkpoint signatures (public key derivable from AID)
✅ Trigger resurrection (but uses CHILD'S identity.json on child's VM)
- Can be resurrected WITHOUT parent involvement
Parent can sign message: { childAID, spawnedAt, parentAID }
Child stores this in first checkpoint metadata
Verify: Child has unique AID different from parent
Verify: Child's first checkpoint has parentAID set correctly
Verify: Parent cannot decrypt child's test checkpoint
